rules.name: SQL Injection - String Concatenation
rules.description: SQL queries should not be constructed using string concatenation with user input
rules.message: Potential SQL injection vulnerability. Use parameterized queries instead.

rules.name: SQL Injection - String Formatting
rules.description: SQL queries should not use string formatting with user input
rules.message: Potential SQL injection via string formatting. Use parameterized queries.

rules.name: Hardcoded Password
rules.description: Passwords should not be hardcoded in source code
rules.message: Hardcoded password detected. Use environment variables or secure vaults.

rules.name: Hardcoded API Key
rules.description: API keys should not be hardcoded in source code
rules.message: Hardcoded API key detected. Use environment variables.

rules.name: Path Traversal
rules.description: File paths should not be constructed from user input without validation
rules.message: Potential path traversal vulnerability. Validate and sanitize file paths.

rules.name: Command Injection - os.system
rules.description: System commands should not include user input
rules.message: Potential command injection. Use subprocess with proper escaping.

rules.name: Insecure Random
rules.description: Use cryptographically secure random for security purposes
rules.message: Insecure random number generator. Use secrets module for security.

rules.name: Use of eval()
rules.description: Avoid using eval() as it can execute arbitrary code
rules.message: Use of eval() is dangerous and can lead to code injection.

rules.name: Weak Cryptography - MD5
rules.description: MD5 is cryptographically broken and should not be used
rules.message: MD5 is insecure. Use SHA-256 or stronger algorithms.

rules.name: Pickle Deserialization
rules.description: Pickle can execute arbitrary code during deserialization
rules.message: Pickle deserialization can execute arbitrary code. Use JSON instead.
